language.entry: In times of need a stranger steps out of the darkness. Her blade may be old and battered, her shabby hooded cloak and the lantern dangling from her belt her only comforts - but her true armour is that of the mind. Long experienced in battling monsters, the Twilight Knight is no stranger to disturbing sights and sounds.

A skilled swordswoman who leads by gleaming example, the Twilight Knight is no stranger to hunting monsters. Whether it be slaughtering them with her blade or exorting others to victory, she remains a calming and encouraging presence on the battlefield. The gentle glow of her lantern may soothe hearts and minds but what price must she pay to bear the burdens of others? Beneath the veneer of calm her psyche remains as fragile as that of any other.

When questioned of her homeland the Twilight Knight remains strangely quiet. However, from various hints she might let slip over time, it is surely a maddening place. Wherever she hails from one thing is certain, she knows how to endure the rigours of survival beyond the safety of town. From time to time she appears to hear her sword speaking to her. Sometimes she even talks back.
A hooded stranger emerges from the shadows - her battered blade bears testimony to many battles.
You shall not die this day. I will not allow it.
Take courage friends. we shall prevail.
Only skill shall see us through this ordeal.
Is, is that all my blood?
Long ago in the land of Stone Faces
Long ago in the land of Stone Faces
Long ago in the land of Stone Faces
Not now, later, when they're sleeping
Not now, later, when they're sleeping
Not now, later, when they're sleeping
Yes I shall kill them all!
Yes I shall kill them all!
Yes I shall kill them all!
The lantern's vibrations shall keep them at bay.
The lantern's vibrations shall keep them at bay.
The lantern's vibrations shall keep them at bay.
Is, is that all my blood?
When the King's Men came we did not resist...
A mighty Watcher lurks in the darkness. You cannot escape it's gaze.
When the Manhunter came he taught us the true meaning of pain.
I don't need you! I'll take them all single handed!
He's my sword and you can't have him!
When the king dies the land dies.
The sun is a lie we tell to our children to give them hope.
I am the light. I am the life.
While the lantern shines you shall be safe.
My foes shall tremble before my might!
Come on. You can do this.
I am not yet ready to give up the blade.
Do I hear the flutter of cancer pigeons?
The antelope has many tiny hands that grab and grip.
I see the way you all look at me.
The manhunter taught us the art of abyssal sadism.
Only in suffering shall I find release.
Bah. Why did I even let you fools tag along?
I deserve a larger share of the treasure.
Not all that glitters is yours.
I have seen the truth. There is no hope.
What fools to think we could stand against these fiends.
Have you met the Lion Knight? He writes the most interesting plays.
The Lion Knight, the Flower Knight, Dung Beetle Knight. Which one am I...?
Do you really want me to tell you about the wetnurses?
We should reteat to the safety of the lantern oven.
The screaming of an Antelope. Flee for your very lives!
A Gorm! A Gorm is coming! Retreat!
If I stand all the way back here ......
The beast is upon us. Like awetnurse in heat!
Let them comne. Let them all come.
This is how a true warrior fights.
Come dance with me at the lantern festival.
The Dung Beetle Knight ever pushes his great ball onwards.
A soft glow leads me forwards.
Do I hear the flutter of cancer pigeons?!
A Gorm! A Gorm is coming! Flee for your very lives!
Death awaits me. I shall not disappoint.
Get behind me. I'll hold them!
All the glory shall be mine.
Out of the way slow coach!
Let's see how some of you do up in front.
Perhaps there's some gold back here.
Faces in the walls, the floor, all watching me...
So many hands. So many faces.
What's that? I can't hear you.
What is it sword? What do you see?
As if you could tell me what to do.
My sword stalls in my hand.
None of you can tell me what to do!
The King's Men fight this way.
What are you all looking at me for?
A true warrior grabs death by the balls!
This is how we do it!
If you watch maybe you'll learn something.
As if a cripple like you could tell me what to do!
I decide who lives or dies!
Oh to emulate the dancing of the Flower Knight!
There once was a dragon who's greatest fear was to be forgotten.
The tree is a trap! The Lonely Tree is a trap!
They're lurking in the dark. Watching.
There is a storm coming. Gorms follow in their wake.
What if we wake up with our throats cut?
Should have found a safer space to camp.
They'll come in the night. You'll see.
You cripples can rest if you must.
You should all give up and go home. I've got this.
Move over. There's hardly room to sleep here.
Find your own place by the fire.
I have no intention to perish on this fool's errand.
The fire flickers but is not warm.
We should return to the settlement.
The darkness has a rhythm. Can you hear it?
When the Lion Knight throws a temper tantrum he reassigns all the roles.
When I fall another must take up the blade.
Pick on someone your own size!
Well it's just going to hit me anyway.
Like moths drawn to the flame....
My sword says you really asked for this.
Stand still and take a beating!
He's my sword and you can't have him!
My sword says you really asked for this.
I want to end this now!
Bloody hell I'm out of here!
To the end! The bitter end!
The sword still wants to fight!
We stand and fight! It's what we do.
I am powerless to defend myself.
You! You let me get hit!
Are you all just going to stand by and let that happen?
Always me. Why is is always me?
Am I supposed to be impressed?
And so the blow is struck.
I don't dare lift a hand....
You fool! Strike at the body. Not their weapon!
Useless. I don't need you anyway.
All the more for me then.
That could be any of us.
Why would you let them hit you?
If only I could share your pain.
Well? Go on then. Hit them back!
Just like the Lion Knight's plays.
Could someone remind me why we are fighting?
Of course they never miss me.
Cherry blossums flutter like exuisite daffodils.
Give them an inch and they'll take a mile.
Here I am and here I stay!
If this is where I am to die then let it be so.
My sword is all I need.
Keep that thing away from me.
I don't need your stupid witchery.
Give it to someone who needs it.
You know, you have some serious trust issues.
But I already had one earlier.
So many fingers! So many hands!
Keep that thing away from me!
Lay hands on me and you'll be the one needing treatment.
Save it for someone more worthy.
If I fall another shall take up the blade.
My sword is wounded. I am fine.
These bandages are loose. Up here, near the crossguard.
If I fall another shall take up the blade.
So many fingers! So many hands!
Get your filthy hands off me!
Only the pure may - what were we doing again?
Just like the hero in an old tale.
It is a good day to die.
The words stick in my throat.
How can I tell them such false truths?
We are watched. I sense it.
How can I trust them all?
The eyes. The hands. The eyes.
If they come in the night we shall be ready.
Pain is good. It hones our senses.
In my land few survive the monsters.
Why should I help these meagre fools?
I pity the fool that turns to me for aid.
Bah. My sword is more deserving of my aid than you.
As if I should give my bounties freely.
My knowlledge is too good to share.
How can I tell them such false truths?
When the wind blows the cradle will rock.
No. That's not how it goes.
My sword is all I need.
Pain is good. It means I'm alive.
As if you could aid me.
My sword is the only ally I need.
Keep your greedy hands to yourselves. I know your kind.
How do I know it isn't poisoned?
I can't eat if you're watching.
When we ran out of food we devoured the corpses.
I'm sure one of you is more needy.
Why fill guts that are due to be spilled?
I absolutely refuse to eat anything with a face!
My sword is all the sustainance that I need.

Dans les temps où la nécessité se fait ressentir une étrangère sort de l'ombre. Son épée est peut être vieille et émoussée, sa capuche en piteuse état; son seul réconfort est sa lanterne qui pend à sa ceinture - mais sa veritable armure est celle de l'esprit. Sa grande experience gagnée au cours de longues batailles contre les creatures de l'ombre, la Chevalière du Crépuscule n'est pas étrangère a cet environnement remplit de curiositées et sons destabilisants.

Une talentueuse épéiste qui donne brillamment l'exemple, la Chevalière du Crépuscule n’est pas étrangère à la chasse aux monstres. Qu’il s’agisse de les meurtrir avec son épée ou exhorter ses compagnons jusqu’à la victoire, elle ramène le calme et reste une présence encourageante sur le champ de bataille. Le scintillement de sa lanterne peut apaiser les cœurs et les esprits mais quel prix doit-elle payer afin de porter le fardeau de ses compagnons? Au-delà de cette armure faite d’esprit et de courage, il reste une personne aussi fragile que n’importe quel autre.

Lorsque l’on tente de la questionner sur sa terre natale, la Chevalière du Crépuscule reste étrangement silencieuce. Cependant, grâce aux allusions qu’elle laisse échapper de temps a autres, on peut se douter qu’il s’agissait d’une terre remplie d’une terrible folie. De temps en temps elle semble écouter son épée ; et il lui arrive même de répondre.
Une étrangère a capuche sort des ténèbres – Sa lame émoussée témoigne de nombreuse batailles.
Tu ne mourras pas aujourd'hui. Je ne le permettrai pas.
Rassemblez votre courage. Nous devons l'emporter.
Notre force peut nous permettre de passer cette épreuve.
Est-ce.. Est-ce la tout mon sang?
Il y a très longtemps dans la terre des Faciès Rocheux..
Il y a très longtemps dans la terre des Faciès Rocheux..
Il y a très longtemps dans la terre des Faciès Rocheux..
Pas maintenant, plus tard, quand ils seront assoupis
Pas maintenant, plus tard, quand ils seront assoupis
Pas maintenant, plus tard, quand ils seront assoupis
Oui! Je devrai tous vous tuer!
Oui! Je devrai tous vous tuer!
Oui! Je devrai tous vous tuer!
Les vibrations de la lanterne devrait les garder au loin.
Les vibrations de la lanterne devrait les garder au loin.
Les vibrations de la lanterne devrait les garder au loin.
Est-ce.. Est-ce la tout mon sang?
Oh, ca vous à fait mal?!
La joue droite est la meilleure!
Lorsque le Roi des Hommes arrive nous ne pouvons pas résister...
Un puissant observateur est tapis dans l'ombre. Vous ne pouvez pas échapper à son regard.
Quand le chasseur d'homme est venu; il nous a enseigné ce qu'est la vraie douleur.
Je n'ai pas besoin de vous! Je peux les anéantir d'une seule main!
Il est mon Epée et vous ne pouvez pas l'avoir!
Quand le Roi meurt, toute sa terre meurt.
La lumière est un mensonge que nous donnons à nos enfants pour leur apporter de l'espoir.
Je suis la lumière. Je suis l'espoir.
Tant que ma lanterne brille nous sommes en sécurité.
Mes ennemis devraient trembler devant ma puissance!
Là où il y a de la lumière, il y a de l'espoir.
Frapez là où il est le plus vulnérable.

In times of need a stranger steps out of the darkness. Her blade may be old and battered, her shabby hooded cloak and the lantern dangling from her belt her only comforts - but her true armour is that of the mind. Long experienced in battling monsters, the Twilight Knight is no stranger to disturbing sights and sounds.

A skilled swordswoman who leads by gleaming example, the Twilight Knight is no stranger to hunting monsters. Whether it be slaughtering them with her blade or exorting others to victory, she remains a calming and encouraging presence on the battlefield. The gentle glow of her lantern may soothe hearts and minds but what price must she pay to bear the burdens of others? Beneath the veneer of calm her psyche remains as fragile as that of any other.

When questioned of her homeland the Twilight Knight remains strangely quiet. However, from various hints she might let slip over time, it is surely a maddening place. Wherever she hails from one thing is certain, she knows how to endure the rigours of survival beyond the safety of town. From time to time she appears to hear her sword speaking to her. Sometimes she even talks back.

W czasach potrzeby nieznajoma wyszła z ciemności. Jej ostrze, choć może być stare i zbite, jej obdarty płaszcz z kapturem i latarnia zwisająca z jej pasa są jedyną jej pociechą - ale jej prawdziwą zbroją jest ta umysłowa. Dobrze doświadczona w walczeniu z potworami, Rycerz Zaćmienia nie jest obca niepokojącym dźwiękom i widokom.

Doświadczona mieczniczka, która prowadzi lśniącym przykładem, Rycerzowi Zaćmienia nie jest obce polowanie na potwory. Czy to masakrowanie ich swoim mieczem, czy prowadzenie innych do zwycięstwa, ona pozostaje uspokajającą i pokrzepiającą obecnością na polu walki. Delikatny blask jej latarni może koić serca i umysły ale jaką cenę musi zapłacić za noszenie ciężarów innych? Za pozorami spokoju jej psychika pozosatje tak samo krucha jak u innych.

Zapytana o jej rodzimy kraj Rycerz Zaćmienia pozostaje dziwnie cicha. Jednak, z różnych wskazówek, które mogą czesem wyślizgnąć się jej, z pewnością jest to szaleńcze miejsce. Skądkolwiek ona pochodzi jedna rzecz jest pewna, że wie jak wytrwać w surowym przetrwaniu poza bezpiecznym miastem. Od czasu do czasu wygląda jakby jej miecz przemawiał do niej. Czasami nawet odpowiada.

Mój miecz to wszystko czego potrzebuję.
Ból jest dobry. To oznacza, żę jestem żywa.
Mój miecz jest jedynym sprzymierzeńcem jakiego potrzebuję.
Trzymajcie swoje chciwe łapska przy sobie. Znam wasz rodzaj.
Jak mogę wiedzieć, że nie jest zatrute?
Kiedy skończy nam się jedzenie pożremy truchła.
Jestem pewna, że ktoś bardziej tego potrzebuje.
Dlaczego napełniać żałądki, które planowane być rozlane?
Absolutnie odmawiam jedzenia czegoś z twarzą!
Mój miecz jest jedyną podporą, której potrzebuje.

In times of need a stranger steps out of the darkness. Her blade may be old and battered, her shabby hooded cloak and the lantern dangling from her belt her only comforts - but her true armour is that of the mind. Long experienced in battling monsters, the Twilight Knight is no stranger to disturbing sights and sounds.

A skilled swordswoman who leads by gleaming example, the Twilight Knight is no stranger to hunting monsters. Whether it be slaughtering them with her blade or exorting others to victory, she remains a calming and encouraging presence on the battlefield. The gentle glow of her lantern may soothe hearts and minds but what price must she pay to bear the burdens of others? Beneath the veneer of calm her psyche remains as fragile as that of any other.

When questioned of her homeland the Twilight Knight remains strangely quiet. However, from various hints she might let slip over time, it is surely a maddening place. Wherever she hails from one thing is certain, she knows how to endure the rigours of survival beyond the safety of town. From time to time she appears to hear her sword speaking to her. Sometimes she even talks back.
A hooded stranger emerges from the shadows - her battered blade bears testimony to many battles.
You shall not die this day. I will not allow it.
Take courage friends. we shall prevail.
Only skill shall see us through this ordeal.
Is, is that all my blood?
Long ago in the land of Stone Faces
Long ago in the land of Stone Faces
Long ago in the land of Stone Faces
Not now, later, when they're sleeping
Not now, later, when they're sleeping
Not now, later, when they're sleeping
Yes I shall kill them all!
Yes I shall kill them all!
Yes I shall kill them all!
The lantern's vibrations shall keep them at bay.
The lantern's vibrations shall keep them at bay.
The lantern's vibrations shall keep them at bay.
Is, is that all my blood?
When the King's Men came we did not resist...
A mighty Watcher lurks in the darkness. You cannot escape it's gaze.
When the Manhunter came he taught us the true meaning of pain.
I don't need you! I'll take them all single handed!
He's my sword and you can't have him!
When the king dies the land dies.
The sun is a lie we tell to our children to give them hope.
I am the light. I am the life.
While the lantern shines you shall be safe.
My foes shall tremble before my might!
Come on. You can do this.
I am not yet ready to give up the blade.
Do I hear the flutter of cancer pigeons?
The antelope has many tiny hands that grab and grip.
I see the way you all look at me.
The manhunter taught us the art of abyssal sadism.
Only in suffering shall I find release.
Bah. Why did I even let you fools tag along?
I deserve a larger share of the treasure.
Not all that glitters is yours.
I have seen the truth. There is no hope.
What fools to think we could stand against these fiends.
Have you met the Lion Knight? He writes the most interesting plays.
The Lion Knight, the Flower Knight, Dung Beetle Knight. Which one am I...?
Do you really want me to tell you about the wetnurses?
We should reteat to the safety of the lantern oven.
The screaming of an Antelope. Flee for your very lives!
A Gorm! A Gorm is coming! Retreat!
If I stand all the way back here ......
The beast is upon us. Like awetnurse in heat!
Let them comne. Let them all come.
This is how a true warrior fights.
Come dance with me at the lantern festival.
The Dung Beetle Knight ever pushes his great ball onwards.
A soft glow leads me forwards.
Do I hear the flutter of cancer pigeons?!
A Gorm! A Gorm is coming! Flee for your very lives!
Death awaits me. I shall not disappoint.
Get behind me. I'll hold them!
All the glory shall be mine.
Out of the way slow coach!
Let's see how some of you do up in front.
Perhaps there's some gold back here.
Faces in the walls, the floor, all watching me...
So many hands. So many faces.
What's that? I can't hear you.
What is it sword? What do you see?
As if you could tell me what to do.
My sword stalls in my hand.
None of you can tell me what to do!
The King's Men fight this way.
What are you all looking at me for?
A true warrior grabs death by the balls!
This is how we do it!
If you watch maybe you'll learn something.
As if a cripple like you could tell me what to do!
I decide who lives or dies!
Oh to emulate the dancing of the Flower Knight!
There once was a dragon who's greatest fear was to be forgotten.
The tree is a trap! The Lonely Tree is a trap!
They're lurking in the dark. Watching.
There is a storm coming. Gorms follow in their wake.
What if we wake up with our throats cut?
Should have found a safer space to camp.
They'll come in the night. You'll see.
You cripples can rest if you must.
You should all give up and go home. I've got this.
Move over. There's hardly room to sleep here.
Find your own place by the fire.
I have no intention to perish on this fool's errand.
The fire flickers but is not warm.
We should return to the settlement.
The darkness has a rhythm. Can you hear it?
When the Lion Knight throws a temper tantrum he reassigns all the roles.
When I fall another must take up the blade.
Pick on someone your own size!
Well it's just going to hit me anyway.
Like moths drawn to the flame....
My sword says you really asked for this.
Stand still and take a beating!
He's my sword and you can't have him!
My sword says you really asked for this.
I want to end this now!
Bloody hell I'm out of here!
To the end! The bitter end!
The sword still wants to fight!
We stand and fight! It's what we do.
I am powerless to defend myself.
You! You let me get hit!
Are you all just going to stand by and let that happen?
Always me. Why is is always me?
Am I supposed to be impressed?
And so the blow is struck.
I don't dare lift a hand....
You fool! Strike at the body. Not their weapon!
Useless. I don't need you anyway.
All the more for me then.
That could be any of us.
Why would you let them hit you?
If only I could share your pain.
Well? Go on then. Hit them back!
Just like the Lion Knight's plays.
Could someone remind me why we are fighting?
Of course they never miss me.
Cherry blossums flutter like exuisite daffodils.
Give them an inch and they'll take a mile.
Here I am and here I stay!
If this is where I am to die then let it be so.
My sword is all I need.
Keep that thing away from me.
I don't need your stupid witchery.
Give it to someone who needs it.
You know, you have some serious trust issues.
But I already had one earlier.
So many fingers! So many hands!
Keep that thing away from me!
Lay hands on me and you'll be the one needing treatment.
Save it for someone more worthy.
If I fall another shall take up the blade.
My sword is wounded. I am fine.
These bandages are loose. Up here, near the crossguard.
If I fall another shall take up the blade.
So many fingers! So many hands!
Get your filthy hands off me!
Only the pure may - what were we doing again?
Just like the hero in an old tale.
It is a good day to die.
The words stick in my throat.
How can I tell them such false truths?
We are watched. I sense it.
How can I trust them all?
The eyes. The hands. The eyes.
If they come in the night we shall be ready.
Pain is good. It hones our senses.
In my land few survive the monsters.
Why should I help these meagre fools?
I pity the fool that turns to me for aid.
Bah. My sword is more deserving of my aid than you.
As if I should give my bounties freely.
My knowlledge is too good to share.
How can I tell them such false truths?
When the wind blows the cradle will rock.
No. That's not how it goes.
My sword is all I need.
Pain is good. It means I'm alive.
As if you could aid me.
My sword is the only ally I need.
Keep your greedy hands to yourselves. I know your kind.
How do I know it isn't poisoned?
I can't eat if you're watching.
When we ran out of food we devoured the corpses.
I'm sure one of you is more needy.
Why fill guts that are due to be spilled?
I absolutely refuse to eat anything with a face!
My sword is all the sustainance that I need.
